greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of even-length compositions of n with alternating parts distinct.
comment: These are finite even-length sequences q of positive integers summing to n such that q(i) != q(i+2) for all possible i.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..500
formula: G.f.: 1 + Sum_{k>=1} B_k(x)^2 where B_k(x) is the g.f. of column k of A106351. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Apr 16 2021
program: (PARI) \\ here gf gives A106351 as g.f.
seq(n)={my(p=gf(n,y)); Vec(sum(k=0, n\2, polcoef(p,k,y)^2))} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Apr 16 2021
xref: The strictly decreasing version appears to be A064428 (odd-length: A001522).
The equal version is A065608 (A342527 with odds).
The weakly decreasing version is A114921 (A342528 with odds).
A000726 counts partitions with alternating parts unequal.
A325545 counts compositions with distinct first differences.
A342529 counts compositions with distinct first quotients.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Mar 28 2021
ext: Terms a(24) and beyond from _Andrew Howroyd_, Apr 16 2021
